item.title: Aya Hachem: Seven men guilty of drive-by shooting murder
item.description: Innocent passer-by Aya Hachem, 19, was shot dead in a feud between two Blackburn tyre firm owners.

item.title: Ever Given: Cargo ship that blocked Suez Canal arrives in Felixstowe
item.description: The Ever Given docks at the Port of Felixstowe months after it was originally due to arrive.

item.title: Tom Miller: Hiding student fell to death at illegal lockdown party
item.description: Rumours of a police raid prompted Tom Miller to climb out of a window, an inquest hears.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Where are Team GBâ€™s English medallists from?
item.description: With day 11 of the competition over, the North West currently leads the way when it comes to medals.

item.title: Robyn Williams: Met Police takes legal action over officer's reinstatement
item.description: Robyn Williams was reinstated after being dismissed over possession of a child abuse video.

item.title: Streatham terror attack: Sudesh Amman 'wanted to kill the Queen'
item.description: Sudesh Amman stabbed two people in south London only days after being released from prison.

item.title: Couple grateful for support after homophobic abuse
item.description: Supportive letters are sent from around the world after an Alderney couple get homophobic abuse.

item.title: Boy, 5, dies after head injury at department store
item.description: Police say specialist officers are supporting the boy's family following his death.

item.title: Ex vicar Paul Battersby jailed again for child sex abuse images
item.description: It is the fourth time the former vicar has been jailed for offences involving child sex abuse.

item.title: Soldier seriously injured at Warcop training camp in Cumbria
item.description: The Ministry of Defence says an investigation has begun to establish what happened.

item.title: Fears grow for missing 12-year-old boy
item.description: Leopold Bennet-Budkinov left his home barefooted and without money or a phone.

item.title: Drug dealers jailed after getting car stuck in trolley bay
item.description: Police found the men with crack cocaine and heroin after they crashed at a Morrison's supermarket.

item.title: Why bonding over the Euros appeared to increase Covid cases in men
item.description: Psychologists say men need to be part of a group in order to vent their feelings and emotions.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: Assisted dying: Campaigners renewed hope for change in the law
item.description: David Peace intends to travel abroad to end his life before his motor neurone disease deteriorates further.

item.title: 'I want to be like Tom Daley'
item.description: Young divers describe how Olympic medallist Tom Daley inspired them to take up the sport.

item.title: West Midlands canal rubbish is 'worst ever'
item.description: The Canal & River Trust says the waste dumped in West Midlands waterways is the worst it's ever seen.

item.title: Charlotte Worthington: Family hope Olympic gold inspires others
item.description: Charlotte Worthington's parents hope her BMX freestyle Olympic gold inspires others.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Man builds squirrel course in Hitchin garden
item.description: Steve Barley spent almost three months building the course, designed around events in a heptathlon.

item.title: Abdullah Balouchi death: Four men jailed for 'senseless' street killing
item.description: The men, aged between 18 and 22, are sentenced for the fatal stabbing of Abdullah Balouchi in Hull.

item.title: Ben Breakwell: Music teacher convicted over sex with teenage students
item.description: The 40-year-old music teacher preyed on students aged between 13 and 16 at a west London school.

item.title: Ferrets abandoned under bush without food or water in Cornwall
item.description: The 12 young ferrets were "thoughtlessly discarded" in a cage in hot weather, the RSPCA said.

item.title: Fire crew spots porcupine on the loose in Harston
item.description: Firefighters have urged residents to be vigilant and say they hope the animal finds its way home.

item.title: Cherries to flood supermarket shelves after July's heatwave
item.description: The bulk of the sudden rush of supply has come from the UK's main cherry-growing area in Kent.

item.title: Premier League: Players from all 20 clubs will continue to take the knee
item.description: Players from all 20 Premier League clubs will continue to take the knee as a symbol of their "unity against all forms of racism".

item.title: Harry Kane: Tottenham Hotspur striker continues stand-off with club
item.description: Tottenham striker Harry Kane has failed to report to the club's training ground for a second day as the stand-off over his future continues amid interest from Manchester City.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: GB's Keely Hodgkinson wins silver behind USA's Athing Mu
item.description: Teenager Keely Hodgkinson wins 800m silver at the Olympic Games in a new British record of 1:55.88 as US star Athing Mu takes gold.
